KY Loloskan Delapan Calon Hakim ad hoc di MA
05 Nov 2019, 20:22 by Suhanda


KY Loloskan Delapan Calon Hakim ad hoc di MA

KBRN, Jakarta : Ketua Bidang Rekrutmen Hakim Komisi Yudisial  Aidul Fitriciada Azhari menyatakan Komisi Yudisial (KY) mengumumkan kelulusan tahap III,  seleksi kesehatan dan kepribadian terhadap 4 orang calon hakim ad hoc Tindak Pidana Korupsi di Mahkamah Agung (MA) dan 4 orang calon hakim ad hoc Hubungan Industrial di MA  dari unsur Apindo dan SP/SB. Hasil ini berdasarkan Rapat Pleno KY pada Selasa, 5 November 2019."Para calon yang lulus tersebut  berhak mengikuti seleksi wawancara pada Jumat, 15 November 2019 untuk calon hakim ad hoc Tipikor di MA dan Senin, 18 November 2019 untuk calon hakim ad hoc Hubungan Industrial di MA," ungkapnya pada wartawan di gedung Komisi  Yudisial Jl. Kramat Raya No.57, Jakarta Pusat. DIjelaskannya 8 orang calon hakim adhoc  terdiri dari berbagai profesi  yang akan dilakukan seleksi tahap selanjutnya."Adapun rincian berdasarkan jenis kelamin, sebanyak 4 orang calon hakim ad hoc Hubungan Industrial di MA merupakan laki-laki, 3 orang calon hakim ad hoc Tipikor di MA merupakan laki-laki dan 1 orang perempuancalon hakim ad hoc Tipikor di MA. Seorang kategori pendidikan, sebanyak 3 orang bergelar doktor dan 1 orang lainnya bergelar magister untuk calon hakim ad hoc Tipikor di MA. Sementara latar belakang pendidikan calon hakim ad hoc Hubungan Industrial di MA bergelar doktor sebanyak 1 orang dan bergelar magister sebanyak 3 orang," jelasnya. Kebutuhan untuk hakim ad hoc pada MA berjumlah sembilan orang dengan rincian: tiga hakim ad hoc Tindak Pidana Korupsi pada MA dan enam hakim ad hoc Hubungan Industrial di MA. Untuk hakim ad hoc Hubungan Industrial pada MA berasal dari unsur Asosiasi Pengusaha Indonesia (APINDO) sebanyak tiga orang dan  Serikat Pekerja/Serikat Buruh berjumlah tiga orang.

KY Passed Eight Ad Hoc Judge Candidates in MA
05 Nov 2019, 20:22 by Suhanda


KY Passed Eight Ad Hoc Judge Candidates in MA

KBRN, Jakarta: Judicial Commission Recruitment Chairperson Aidul Fitriciada Azhari said the Judicial Commission (KY) announced stage III graduation, health and personality selection of 4 ad hoc judge candidates for corruption in the Supreme Court (MA) and 4 prospective ad judges hoc Industrial Relations in the MA from Apindo and SP / SB elements. These results are based on the KY Plenary Meeting on Tuesday, November 5, 2019. "The candidates who pass are entitled to participate in interview selection on Friday, November 15, 2019 for prospective ad hoc judges in the Supreme Court and Monday, November 18, 2019 for prospective ad hoc judges Industrial Relations in the Supreme Court, "he told reporters at the Judicial Commission building Jl. Kramat Raya No.57, Jakarta Pusat. He explained 8 candidates for ad hoc judges consisting of various professions to be selected in the next stage. "As for the details based on sex, as many as 4 candidates for ad hoc judges Industrial Relations in the MA are male, 3 candidates for the ad hoc judge Corruption in the Supreme Court are male and 1 female ad hoc judge Corruption in MA A category of education, as many as 3 people holding a doctorate and 1 other holding a master degree for prospective ad hoc judge Corruption in the MA while the educational background of the ad hoc judge in Industrial Relations at the MA holds 1 doctoral degree and 3 master's degrees, "he explained. The need for ad hoc judges in the Supreme Court is nine people with details: three ad hoc judges for Corruption in the Supreme Court and six ad hoc judges for Industrial Relations in the Supreme Court. For ad hoc judges Industrial Relations at the MA come from the elements of the Indonesian Employers' Association (APINDO) as many as three people and trade unions / labor unions numbered three people.
